guestUserPolicyForStaff.p: Guest access should only be granted to users that do not have institutional access. Please be sure to set an expiration date for guest users. When guest access is granted, the user will be sent an e-mail with a URL that will allow them to set their own password. This password will work for them until guest access expires.

Granting guest access will not prevent users with institutional access from logging in as normal, but it will allow these users to login when their institutional access is revoked. It can also lead to confusion as to how to log in, so avoid granting guess access to instituional members when possible, and only for limited amounts of time.
Issues with institutional access need to be resolved through campus IT.

newUserPolicyForStaff.p: User accounts should only be created for people not affiliated with the university (Not students, Not faculty), and for new Library staff that will be working with this application as part of their work. Accounts are created for students and faculty nightly based on enrollment.

Creating an account does not automatically grant users access. Normal accounts must login using their institutional credentials. To grant a user without institutional credentials access you must also grant guest access while or after creating their account.
